summary: This is an email from a prosecutor to Judge Nathan regarding the case US v. Maxwell, concerning a motion to admit minor victims' birth certificates as self-authenticating evidence. It includes attachments of the motion in unredacted and proposed redaction forms.

events.title: Motion to Admit Birth Certificates
events.description: Prosecution files a motion to determine that minor victims' birth certificates are self-authenticating evidence in US v. Maxwell.

locations.context: Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
Federal judicial district where the case US v. Maxwell is being prosecuted.

keyFacts: The prosecution is seeking to admit minor victims' birth certificates as self-authenticating evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The motion was filed on November 18, 2021, and submitted to Judge Nathan on November 19, 2021.
The email correspondence includes both unredacted and proposed redaction versions of the motion, indicating sensitivity around victim identities.
The communication involves key legal parties: the U.S. Attorney's Office and Maxwell's defense attorneys Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca.
